Bloody Mary.Description: Say Bloody Mary three times before bedtime. When you wake up in the morning, be sure to have one.
Ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces vodka (or peppered vodka for spice)
Steps: 1. Chill a cocktail shaker.
2. Add vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, Tabasco sauce, and Worcestershire sauce.
3. Add salt, pepper, and horseradish to taste.
4. Pour into a chilled collins glass or beer mug.
5. Garnish with a lime slice or a celery stalk. Also preferred as garnishes: pickled green beans, okra pods, and garlic stuffed olives.

Vodka Mint.Description: Caution: An oft-used tool for sweet-faced motherly interrogators.
Steps: 1. Combine limeade, vodka, and mint leaves with enough ice to fill blender.
2. Blend at highest speed until slushy. Pour into cocktail glasses.
3. Top with thin slices of lime and mint leaves.

Polynesian Pick Me Up.Description: No, this does not involve carting a virgin off to the volcano. Your fate is much more pleasant.
Steps: 1. Pour all ingredients into a blender.
2. Blend for 10 seconds on high speed.
3. Pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
4. Dust with cayenne pepper.

Ramos Gin Fizz.Description: Fun fact: Whenever legendary Louisiana governor Huey P. Long traveled to New York City, he took his own New Orleans bartender so he could have this drink made right.
Ingredients: 3 to 4 drops of orange flower water
Steps: 1. Fill cocktail shaker with ice.
2. Add gin, cream, lemon juice, egg white, powdered sugar, orange flower water, and lime juice.
3. Shake.
4. Strain into a goblet.
5. Top with chilled club soda.

Sangria.Description: Perfect setting: pitcher for two, Melrose Avenue, a night of endless possibilities.
Steps: 1. Pour wine into a glass pitcher.
2. Add peeled and sliced peach and lemon slices.
3. Add cognac, triple sec, maraschino liqueur, and sugar.
4. Stir to dissolve sugar.
5. Carefully place the orange in the pitcher.
6. Let mixture marinate at room temperature for at least 1 hour.
7. Add soda and 1 tray of ice cubes to pitcher.
8. Stir.
9. Pour into wine goblets.

Peach Mimosa.Description: Perfect setting: pitcher for two, Melrose Avenue, a night of endless possibilities.
Steps: 1. Pour peach schnapps into a champagne flute.
2. Add enough orange juice to fill half of the glass.
3. Top with champagne.
1. Combine all ingredients in a pitcher.
2. Stir.
3. Chill in refrigerator.
4. Pour into highball glasses with ice.
5. Garnish with orange slices.

Perfect Peach Julep.Description: Even more Southern than the mint julep—if that’s possible.
Steps: 1. Peel, pit, and slice peach.
2. Puree the peach in a blender.
3. Add sugar and process.
4. Stir in bourbon.
5. Pour over crushed ice in silver julep cup.
6. Garnish with mint springs.

Sea Breeze.Description: Drink while watching America’s Cup. Wish for a sailboat of your own.
Steps: 1. Build gin, brandy, grenadine, and lemon juice in a highball glass.
2. Add ice.
3. Fill with club soda.
4. Add mint sprigs.

Cape Coda.Description: Conjures up morning memories from Martha’s Vineyard. Even if you’ve never visited.
Steps: 1. Fill cocktail shaker with ice.
2. Add vodka, juices, and sugar.
3. Shake.
4. Strain into cocktail glass.
